GustAngle.name: GustAngle
GustAngle.description: Direction of the last 5 min highest gust wind

GustStrength.name: GustStrength
GustStrength.description: Speed of the last 5 min highest gust wind

Pressure.name: Pressure
Pressure.description: Last Sea level pressure measured @ time_utc (in mb)

WindAngle.name: WindAngle
WindAngle.description: Current 5 min average wind direction measured @ time_utc (in Â°)

WindStrength.name: WindStrength
WindStrength.description: Current 5 min average wind speed measured @ time_utc (in km/h)

date_max_temp.name: date_max_temp
date_max_temp.description: Timestamp when max temperature was measured

date_min_temp.name: date_min_temp
date_min_temp.description: Timestamp when min temperature was measured

max_temp.name: max_temp
max_temp.description: Min temperature of the day (measured @ date_min_temp)

min_temp.name: min_temp
min_temp.description: Max temperature of the day (measured @ date_max_temp)

sum_rain_1.name: sum_rain_1
sum_rain_1.description: Amount of rain in last hour

dashboard_data.name: dashboard_data
dashboard_data.description: It contains all the measurements that can be displayed on the dashboard

modules.name: modules
modules.description: It lists which modules are linked with this device

type.name: type
type.description:
Included in every device or module. It defines the type of the device/module. Its values are among :
NAMain : for the base station
NAModule1 : for the outdoor module
NAModule4 : for the additionnal indoor module
NAModule3 : for the rain gauge module
NAPlug : for the thermostat relay/plug
NATherm1 : for the thermostat module

wifi_status.name: wifi_status
wifi_status.description:
It contains the current wifi status. The different thresholds to take into account are
RSSI_THRESHOLD_0 = 86 bad signal
RSSI_THRESHOLD_1 = 71 middle quality signal
RSSI_THRESHOLD_2 = 56 good signal

dashboard_data.name: dashboard_data
dashboard_data.description: It contains all the measurements that can be displayed on the dashboard

type.name: type

wifi_status.description:

RSSI_THRESHOLD_0 = 86 bad signal
RSSI_THRESHOLD_1 = 71 middle quality signal
RSSI_THRESHOLD_2 = 56 good signal

battery_vp.name: battery_vp
battery_vp.description:
It contains the current battery status. The threshold depends on the kind of module, below is the list of the different threshold to take into account according the module type.
"Indoor module Battery range: 6000 ... 4200" |
INDOOR_BATTERY_LEVEL_FULL = 5640
INDOOR_BATTERY_LEVEL_HIGH = 5280
INDOOR_BATTERY_LEVEL_MEDIUM = 4920
INDOOR_BATTERY_LEVEL_LOW = 4560
"Below 4560: very low" |
  
"Raingauge and outdoor module Battery range: 6000 ... 3600" |
BATTERY_LEVEL_FULL = 5500
BATTERY_LEVEL_HIGH = 5000
BATTERY_LEVEL_MEDIUM = 4500
BATTERY_LEVEL_LOW = 4000
"Below 4000: very low" |
  
"Thermostat Battery range: 4500 ... 3000" |
THERMOSTAT_BATTERY_LEVEL_FULL = 4100
THERMOSTAT_BATTERY_LEVEL_HIGH = 3600
THERMOSTAT_BATTERY_LEVEL_MEDIUM = 3300
THERMOSTAT_BATTERY_LEVEL_LOW = 3000
"Below 3000: very low"

dashboard_data.name: dashboard_data
dashboard_data.description: It contains all the measurements that can be displayed on the dashboard

rf_status.description:
"It contains the current radio status. The different thresholds to take into account are :" |

RADIO_THRESHOLD_SIGNAL_MEDIUM = 80
RADIO_THRESHOLD_SIGNAL_HIGH = 70
RADIO_THRESHOLD_SIGNAL_FULL = 60

administrative.name: administrative
administrative.description: Contains administrative information related to the user

devices.name: devices
devices.description: An array of string containing the ids of the devices owned by the user

friend_devices.name: friend_devices
friend_devices.description: An array of string containing the ids of the devices on which the user has a "guest" access

feel_like_algo.name: feel_like_algo
feel_like_algo.description: algorithm used to compute feel like temperature, 0 -> humidex, 1 -> heat-index

reg_locale.name: reg_locale
reg_locale.description: user regional preferences (used for displaying date)

is_local.name: is_local
is_local.description: Only for scope access_camera. If Camera and application requesting the information are on the same IP (true/false)

sd_status.name: sd_status
sd_status.description: If SD card status is ok (on/off)

vpn_url.name: vpn_url
vpn_url.description: Only for scope access_camera. Address of the camera

is_arrival.name: is_arrival
is_arrival.description: If person was considered away before being seen during this event

person_id.name: person_id
person_id.description: Id of the person the event is about (if any)

snapshot.name: snapshot
snapshot.description: Snapshot id, version and key. (Used in Getcamerapicture)

sub_type.name: sub_type
sub_type.description: Subtypes of SD and Alim events. Go to Welcome page for further details.

type.name: type
type.description: Type of events. Go to the Welcome page for further details.

video_status.name: video_status
video_status.description: Status of the video (recording, deleted or available)

key.name: key
key.description: Key for this face to use in getcamerapicture.

version.name: version
version.description: Version of the face if user changed their photo.

last_activity.name: last_activity
last_activity.description: Timestamp of last move detected by the module

name.name: name
name.description: name of the module (given by the user)

last_seen.name: last_seen
last_seen.description: Time at which the person was last seen.

out_of_sight.name: out_of_sight
out_of_sight.description: True if the Person is out of sight.

pseudo.name: pseudo
pseudo.description: Name of the person, if pseudo is missing, person is unknown.

reg_locale.name: reg_locale
reg_locale.description: user regional preferences (used for displaying date)

title: Netatmo
description:
Welcome to the Netatmo swagger on-line documentation !

This site is a complement to the official Netatmo developper documentation using swagger to bring interactivity and easy testing of requests with the "try it" button (authenticate with the authorization code 0Auth2 flow by clicking the authenticate button in the methods). You can find the source code for this site can be found in the project netatmo-swagger-ui. You can also use the online swagger declaration file to generate code or static documentation (see netatmo-swagger-api).

app_type.name: app_type
app_type.description: Webhooks are only available for Welcome, enter app_camera.

methods.description: Links a callback url to a user.
The method createnewschedule creates a new schedule stored in the backup list.

app_type.name: app_type
app_type.description: Defines which device type will be returned by devicelist. It could be app_thermostat or app_station (by default if not provided)

device_id.name: device_id
device_id.description: Specify a device_id if you want to retrieve only this device informations.

get_favorites.name: get_favorites
get_favorites.description: When set to "true", the favorite devices of the user are returned. This flag is available only if the devices requested are Weather Stations.

methods.description:
The method devicelist returns the list of devices owned by the user, and their modules.
A device is identified by its _id (which is its mac address) and each device may have one, several or no modules, also identified by an _id.
Dissociates a webhook from a user.

image_id.name: image_id
image_id.description: id of the image (can be retrieved as 'id' in 'face' in Gethomedata, or as 'id' in 'snapshot' in Getnextevents, Getlasteventof and Geteventsuntil)

methods.description: Returns the snapshot associated to an event.

home_id.name: home_id
home_id.description: ID of the Home you're interested in

event_id.name: event_id
event_id.description: Your request will retrieve all the events until this one

methods.description: Returns the snapshot associated to an event.

home_id.name: home_id
home_id.description: Specify if you're looking for the events of a specific Home.

size.name: size
size.description: Number of events to retrieve. Default is 30.

methods.description: Returns information about users homes and cameras.

home_id.name: home_id
home_id.description: ID of the Home you're interested in

person_id.name: person_id
person_id.description: Your request will retrieve all events of the given home until the most recent event of the given person

offset.name: offset
offset.description: Number of events to retrieve. Default is 30.

device_id.name: device_id
device_id.description: Id of the device whose module's measurements you want to retrieve. This _id can be found in the user's devices field.

module_id.name: module_id
module_id.description: If you don't specify any module_id you will retrieve the device's measurements. If you specify a module_id you will retrieve the module's measurements.

scale.name: scale
scale.description:
Defines the time interval between two measurements.
Possible values :
max -> every value stored will be returned
30min -> 1 value every 30 minutes
1hour -> 1 value every hour
3hours -> 1 value every 3 hours
1day -> 1 value per day
1week -> 1 value per week
1month -> 1 value per month

type.name: type
type.description:
Sets the type of measurement you want to retrieve.
The different types of measurements must be given in a comma separated list of strings.
Example: type="Temperature,Humidity"
Depending on the device's type and the scale, different measurements are available:
For Weather Station :

  max -> Temperature, CO2, Humidity, Pressure, Noise, Rain (if
module_id is a rain sensor)

  30min, 1hour, 3hours -> Temperature, CO2, Humidity, Pressure,
Noise, min_temp, max_temp, min_hum, max_hum, min_pressure, max_pressure, min_noise, max_noise, sum_rain (if module_id is a rain sensor)

  1day, 1week, 1month -> Temperature, Co2, Humidity, Pressure, Noise,
min_temp, date_min_temp, max_temp, date_max_temp, min_hum, date_min_hum, max_hum, date_max_hum, min_pressure, date_min_pressure, max_pressure, date_max_pressure, min_noise, date_min_noise, max_noise, date_max_noise, date_min_co2, date_max_co2, sum_rain (if module_id is a rain sensor)
Please note, the measurements sent in the response will be in the same order as in this list.
All measurements are expressed in metric units:

  Temperature: Celsius

  Humidity: %

  Co2: ppm

  Pressure: mbar

  Noise: db

  Rain: mm

For Thermostat:

  max -> Temperature, Sp_Temperature, BoilerOn, BoilerOff

  30min, 1hour, 3hours -> Temperature, Sp_Temperature, min_temp,
max_temp, sum_boiler_on, sum_boiler_off

  1day, 1week, 1month -> Temperature, min_temp, date_min_temp,
max_temp, sum_boiler_on, sum_boiler_off

  where

Temperature: Celsius

  Sp_Temperature (temperature setpoint): Celsius

  BoilerOn: Duration, since the previous data point, during which the
boiler has been on (in seconds)

  BoilerOff : Duration, since the previous data point, during which
the boiler has been off (in seconds).

  sum_boiler_on: Total duration during which the boiler has been on,
at a specific scale (in seconds).

  sum_boiler_off: Total duration during which the boiler has been
off, at a specific scale (in seconds).

date_begin.name: date_begin
date_begin.description:
Starting timestamp (utc) of the requested measurements.
Please note measurement retrieving is limited to 1024 measurements.

date_end.name: date_end
date_end.description:
Ending timestamp (utc) of the request measurements.
If you want only the last measurement, do not provide date_begin, and set date_end to "last".

limit.name: limit
limit.description: Limits the number of measurements returned (default & max is 1024)

optimize.name: optimize
optimize.description:
Allows you to choose the format of the answer.
If you build a mobile app and bandwith usage is an issue, use optimize = true.
Use optimize = false, for an easier parse. In this case, values are indexed by sorted timestamp.
Example of un-optimized response :
{"status": "ok", 
  "body": {
    "1347575400": [18.3,39],
    "1347586200": [20.6,48]
  },
"time_exec": 0.012136936187744}
If optimize is set true, measurements are returned as an array of series of regularly spaced measurements. Each series is defined by a beginning time beg_time and a step between measurements, step_time:
{"status": "ok",
  "body": [
    {"beg_time": 1347575400,
     "step_time": 10800,
     "value": 
        [[18.3,39],
        [ 20.6,48]]
    }],
"time_exec": 0.014238119125366}
Default value is true.

real_time.name: real_time
real_time.description:
In scales higher than max, since the data is aggregated, the timestamps returned are by default offset by +(scale/2).
For instance, if you ask for measurements at a daily scale, you will receive data timestamped at 12:00 if real_time is set to false (default case), and timestamped at 00:00 if real_time is set to true.
NB : The servers always store data with real_time set to true and data are offset by this parameter AFTER having being time-filtered, thus you could have data after date_end if real_time is set to false.

methods.description: The method getmeasure returns the measurements of a device or a module.

home_id.name: home_id
home_id.description: ID of the Home you're interested in

event_id.name: event_id
event_id.description: Your request will retrieve events occured before this one

size.name: size
size.description: Number of events to retrieve. Default is 30.

device_id.name: device_id
device_id.description: Id of the device you want to retrieve information of

methods.description: The method getstationsdata Returns data from a user Weather Stations (measures and device specific data).

device_id.name: device_id
device_id.description: Id of the device you want to retrieve information of

methods.description: The method getthermostatsdata returns information about user's thermostats such as their last measurements.
The method getthermstate returns the last Thermostat measurements, its current weekly schedule, and, if present, its current manual temperature setpoint.
The method getuser returns information about a user such as prefered language, prefered units, and list of devices.
The method partnerdevices returns the list of device_id to which your partner application has access to.

home_id.name: home_id
home_id.description: ID of the Home you're interested in

person_id.name: person_id
person_id.description: If a person_id is specified, that person will be set as 'Away'. If no person_id is specified, the Home will be set as 'Empty'.

methods.description: Sets a person as 'Away' or the Home as 'Empty'. The event will be added to the userâs timeline.

setpoint_endtime.name: setpoint_endtime
setpoint_endtime.description: When using the manual or max setpoint_mode, this parameter defines when the setpoint expires.

setpoint_temp.name: setpoint_temp
setpoint_temp.description: When using the manual setpoint_mode, this parameter defines the temperature setpoint (in Celcius) to use.

methods.description: The method setthermpoint changes the Thermostat manual temperature setpoint.

schedule_id.name: schedule_id
schedule_id.description: The schedule id. It can be found in the getthermstate response, under the keys "therm_program_backup" and "therm_program".

methods.description: The method switchschedule switches the Thermostat's schedule to another existing schedule.
The method syncschedule changes the Thermostat weekly schedule.
